intro: Cissus karaguensis, commonly known as the African stonecrop, is a climbing or trailing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often lobed or serrated, and the stems can develop aerial roots for support. Cissus karaguensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
